title: Black Guns Matter On Capitol Hill
text:
Maj Toure, the founder of Black Guns Matter, was on Capitol Hill Thursday testifying in opposition to more gun control laws. He joins Cam to talk about what his group is doing to reduce violence in urban areas, and why gun control advocates are making things worse.

Plus, Cam speaks with Steffon Josey, who ran up against New Jersey's crazy gun laws and was arrested for illegal gun possession. Steffon was ultimately pardoned by then-Gov. Chris Christie, and is now trying to get a job with the very department responsible for his arrest.
